alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 3:01PM MDT until June 11 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Showers and thunderstorms from earlier Wednesday afternoon produced very heavy rain in the North Fork Powder River drainage around Mayoworth. The rain has caused minor flooding. Water levels have risen quickly on the tributaries and main stem North Fork, which was running bankfull near Mayoworth at 3 PM. Other creeks emerging from the east slopes of the Bighorn Range may also be experiencing minor flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding and flooding of normally dry draws caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Johnson. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry draws. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 251 PM MDT, Doppler radar estimated 1.5 to 2.5 inches of rain fell earlier Wednesday afternoon around Mayoworth and along the east slopes of the Bighorn Mountains. The rain will cause small stream flooding and rapid river rises on the North Fork Powder River. Minor flooding is occurring in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inch are possible over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mayoworth and Dullknife Reservoir.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
